DESCRIPTION: Archers are martial units that fight with bows
Journeyman are martial units that fight with axes
Soldiers are martial units that fight with lances
Swordsman are martial units that fight with swords
Mages are magic units that fight with anima magic
Monks are magic units that fight with light magic
Shamans are magic units that fight with dark magic
Clerics are magic units that uses staves
Marksman are dedicated to their skill with a bow
Nomads have become proficient using a bow while on horseback
Brigands are axe users who have trained in rough terrain to become tough and agile
Fighters are axe users who have trained to become strong and durable
Pirates are axe users who have trained on the seas and are accustomed to a variety of challenges
Caveliers have learned to wield swords and lances while riding horseback
Knights are lance users that have trained their bodies to easily carry the weight of the heavy armour they wear
Pegasus knights have learned to wield lances while gracefully flying on Pegasi
Wyvern knights have become deadly wyvern riding lance users
Mercenaries train their bodies to become formidable sword users
Myrmidons have honed their skill with their swords to a higher level than most
Sages continue their study of anima magic while learning to use staves
Troubadours have learned to use anima magic and staves while on horseback
Bishops spend much of their time practicing their use of light magic and staves
Diviners strive to excel in their skill with light magic
Druids continue their study of dark magic while learning to use staves
Summoners strive to excel in their skill with dark magic
Berserkers have mastered the use of axes and delight in the chance to test their immense skill in any terrain
Corsairs are swift, skillful, expert axe users who are also practiced with a sword
Dracoknights have become deadly with both lances and bows while flying on the backs of wyvern
Falcoknights have become experts with both lances and bows while flying on the backs of pegasi
Generals have mastered their ability to wield powerful lances and imprentrable armour
Great knights wear heavy armour, on armoured horseback, wielding both lances and axes
Heros have become all-around experts in their use of both axes and swords
Paladins have learned to wield axes, lances, and swords, while riding on horseback
Pegasus Lords have become experts with both lances and swords while flying on the backs of pegasi
Rangers wield bows and swords to hunt while their horses have grown accustom to the dense forests they travel
Assassins are masters of the sword who specialize in fatal blows
Swordmasters have pushed their skills with a sword beyond all others
Rogues are masters of the sword who value being quick and quiet while the empty their enemies pockets
Snipers are masters of the bow whose accuracy is matched by no other
Warriors are resilient and embrace rough terrain while fighting with axes and bows
Wyvern Lords have become deadly with both lances and axes while flying on the backs of wyvern
Ardruids are experts in anima magic, dark magic, and staves
Archsages are experts in anima magic, light magic, and staves
Archbishops are experts in dark magic, light magic, and staves
Mage Knights swiftly ride on horseback while wielding anima and dark magic
Valkeries are horseback riders that are experts in anima magic and staves
Cardinals are experts in light magic and staves
Oracles' faith have led them to the mastery light magic
Dark Druids are experts in dark magic and staves
Necromancers dedication to the dark arts has helped them master dark magic
Sorcers have dedicated themselves to become experts in anima magic and staves
